definition: to harness/to draw (a cart etc)/to drive/to pilot/to sail/to ride/your good self/prefixed word denoting respect (polite 敬辞)
to gallop/speedily/to proceed to/to pilot (ship, plane etc)/to sail
cabin/the hold of a ship or airplane

sentences.english: Transom mand cockpit components sorted and being moved to the boat.
sentences.chinese: 横梁和驾驶舱部分排序和被转移到小船。

sentences.english: It features two fire-linked laser cannons chin-mounted on the ball-shaped cockpit.
sentences.chinese: 它有两门火力同步激光炮被安装在球型驾驶舱下部。

sentences.english: Inside, the cabin is well laid-out and the low driving position is good.
sentences.chinese: 驾驶舱布局合理，还有那绝好的低位驾驶姿势。

sentences.english: One application of key interest is extinguishing cockpit fires, he said.
sentences.chinese: 一个主要的应用是扑灭驾驶舱的火焰，他说。

sentences.english: Cockpits are night vision goggle compatible.
Two-seaters also have curved strakes below the cockpit along the lower fuselage.
sentences.chinese: 双座机型亦会在驾驶舱下两侧加上曲线型边条。

sentences.english: I can smell the gunpowder all the way up here in the cockpit.
sentences.chinese: 一路上我都可以从驾驶舱里闻到火药味。

sentences.english: Small cockpit fires may also be better suited to this technology than larger fires.
sentences.chinese: 小型驾驶舱的火焰比大型火焰更适用于这种技术。

sentences.english: Quantity (pressure) indication is provided by a gage in the flight compartment.
sentences.chinese: 流量指示由驾驶舱内的压强计指示。

sentences.english: Transom and cockpit components sorted and being moved to the boat.
sentences.chinese: 横梁和驾驶舱部分排序和被转移到小船。

sentences.english: Created using Alcantara , carbon fiber, aluminium and leather, the interior is inspired by modern aircraft cockpits.
sentences.chinese: 碳纤维，铝和皮革，内部是由现代飞机的驾驶舱。

sentences.english: Under his bubble canopy, the Colonel scans the gloom of the forest.
sentences.chinese: 在肥皂泡一样的驾驶舱罩里，上校扫描着阴暗的森林。

sentences.english: The astromech droid head seen behind the cockpit was interchangeable.
sentences.chinese: 出现在驾驶舱后面的宇航技工机器人是可以换的。

sentences.english: Josh reaches into the cockpit of the powersuit and hits the fire control button.
sentences.chinese: Jake把手伸进机甲的驾驶舱狂按火力控制按钮。

sentences.english: Mark snaps as he climbs back into the cockpit.
sentences.chinese: 马克一边厉声地说，一边钻进驾驶舱。

sentences.english: Donier's cockpit of Hainan airlines, which looks more advanced than Boeing 737 series.
sentences.chinese: 海航多尼尔的驾驶舱，看起来还比较先进的。

definition: cabin/the hold of a ship or airplane
the rear (tail) of a plane etc
the front (nose) of a plane etc
